title: Ticket #6360: per-thread keyring sessions not supported in pre 3.0.0 kernel
description:
If we are using clone() to spawn shadows, kernel versions before 3.0.0 do not support creating a new session within the clone. If we detect this configuration, we should EXCEPT right away. The sysadmin can set 
USE_CLONE_TO_CREATE_PROCESSES = false
to workaround the issue. Although that does impact performance on heavily-loaded schedds, the alternative is not being able to spawn shadows at all.

The proposed patch will not allow HTCondor to start if we detect an invalid combination of kernel version, USE_KEYRING_SESSIONS, and USE_CLONE_TO_CREATE_PROCESSES.

All in all, it seems like setting USE_KEYRING_SESSIONS=True on anything older than a v3.x Linux Kernel (i.e. anything older than RHEL7) is just a bad idea for several reasons, including both this ticket and the fact that creating a new session on RHEL6 is several orders of slower than on RHEL7 (on RHEL6 creating a new session takes ~7.5ms!).
